content:
stem
are comprised of single or several molecules, there are no black boxes to in-
voke. The consequences of even a single gap in the transport chain can be
seen in the hereditary defect known as I-cell disease. It results from a defi-
ciency of the enzyme that places the mannose-6-phosphate on proteins to be
targeted  to  the  lysosomes.  I-cell  disease  is  characterized  by  progressive  
retardation, skeletal deformities, and early death.
